alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 11:19PM EST until December 21 at 12:34AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff continues. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast, East Central, North Central, and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1118 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rainfall runoff in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Houlton, Millinocket, Dover-Foxcroft, Howland, Patten, Danforth, Brownville Junction, Milo, East Millinocket, Medway, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Springfield, Amity, Topsfield, Haynesville and Sherman Station. - Numerous reports of flooding inside the advisory area impacting several roadways. - For Flood Safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
